column4: Hello.  Anyone know where to enter email passwords in Evolution?  I put in all mu information and checked "remember passwords" but it doesn't give an area to type in the password.
it will ask for them when first connecting ...
no HID is human input device. mouses tablets keyboards
do « tailf /var/log/messages » in a terminal and then plug the usb drive. paste the new messages that will appear in the terminal in a pastebin
copy your ~/.profile to the remote machine
copy your ~/.profile to the remote machine <<<
http://pastebin.com/NTXgeeQm   This is what happens after turning on the drive
Switched on, plugged into to power after it was not plugged in to power
your disk seems to be sdc but it gives a lot of low level errors ....
Is it possible that there is something wrong with the circuit board on the drive?  I read that these have issue with the board, and taking the drive out of the casing my fix it.
really dunno; you will have to try if you can
It shows up in computer (not in places) as a usb symbol and says Cypress AT2LP, but can't open it.  Is there any way to get gparted to see it?
It apears to have found it.  i love you!
